alert.note: Alert for Putnam; Westchester (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 27 at 1:03PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast New York, including the following counties, Putnam and Westchester. * WHEN...Until 400 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 101 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to showers and embedded thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen over the past hour. - Additional rainfall amounts up to around 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Peekskill, Mahopac, Lake Carmel, Brewster, Ridgefield, Carmel, Yorktown Heights, Fahnestock State Park, Jefferson Valley, Patterson, Putnam Valley, Putnam Lake, Brewster Hill, Golden`s Bridge and Peach Lake. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
